medical_history.chief_complaint: Poorly controlled hypertension and abnormal serum creatinine.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been noted for slowly growing fat masses in his neck and upper trunk for the past 6 months. These symptoms progressed without affecting the function of his arms, and he denied any difficulty breathing, swallowing or speaking. His hypertension was reported as poorly controlled about 3 weeks prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had hypertension for 10 years and gouty arthritis affecting predominantly the small joints of his hands.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a long-term smoker with 40 pack-years and an alcoholic, consuming about 10 units of alcohol daily for 20 years until a few weeks before his hospital admission.
